review_title: I like it but I wish more people are on
one_reviews_text: is there a discord or a timezone that has people play together? anyway the game is just great I love everything about it
I love the game but it doesn't load through Virtual desktop

review_title: I haven't bought the game yet but...
one_reviews_text: I've been trying to figure out if I should refund it because its not working through virtual desktop but when I launch it without my headset being attached through the vrdesktop it works just fine but won't let me play if I put the headset back on. Im just wording if there will be a fix to it soon if ever. I've played it on other headsets when going to a gaming center. I love this game but if it doesn't start working soon I'm going to be really dissapointed.
all u do is run around kill robots and using spells

Raw Data is not as extremely polished as Robo Recall, but it still is a very cool experience so far. I already hit my realworld lamp above me. That happens only when I am getting REALLY immersed in a VR game...! I like it when they sometimes use the Japanese language to say some strange things while these robots are coming. This gives it really a special atmosphere! I am only at the beginning of the game, let's see how this will develop... Will update later.

It shows a lot of potential but most of it annoys me, from the pop ups that constantly pop up blocking your view (that admittedly you can turn off but you have to go hunting through menus) to the stages where you have to dodge lazers but if you dodge too much you have to stand around like a lemon and take hits. To the constant babbling of the characters that you can't skip. Found myself alt+f4 the game just to end it

So I get to the first tutorial (pistol) and it won't even load.  I teleport over to the spot and there's nothing to interact and engage with to start the tutorial.  The free-move controls are also... clunky?  Moving at a diagonal just feels weird.

I purchased this game on the PSVR and have now picked it up on the Rift (for my Quest using virtual desktop). 
This game is truly legendary! :)
A great addition to any VR library! <3
one of the best vr games out there very exciting levels very challenging and just altogether fun
Through all of my expieriences this has to be one of the best, the feel you get from playing each character is amazing.

review_title: Fun but way too much crashing
one_reviews_text: It's a fun game if you don't mind the slight repetitiveness off going back through levels to unlock all the character's abilities. My only real issue with the game is it continously crashes on me. I have well above the recommended specs in my pc but for some reason that is usually how my sessions on the game end.
review_feedback: Hey there, Apologies for these crashing issues you're experiencing with Raw Data. Please feel free to contact us at support@survios.com and we'd be more than happy to help troubleshoot this issue with you!

review_title: Great Game, Took Some Time To Grow On Me
one_reviews_text:
I first played this game months ago on a free play weekend.  At that time I went through the tutorials, considered it another wave shooter and put it away.
This game is fun and actually EXCITING, and I'm only on the 6th mission.  The four different playable characters are each unique and powerful enough that they are fun to play.  The gun, sword, and bow mechanics are each impressive, and the pace of the game is perfect.  It isn't a mad rush, but it isn't a slow easy walkthrough either.  I like that the difficulty can be adjusted as well.
This will be a go-to game for me for a good while.

the game is a lot of fun and would be a five star but there are barely any one on multiplayer and there are only two people but im fine with that. some small bugs so far like not being able to move when at the center thing but i can just go to training and pick one of those and move again. but there was one that kept me in the loading screen when i could hear the lobby. otherwise it is fun.

Prøvde dette spillet under free-weekend, heldigvis.
Tutorialen fungerte ikke, så jeg vet ikke om det er noe bra jeg ikke har fått med meg, men når ting ikke fungerer så betyr det meget lite.
Jeg gjorde et mission, meget kjedelig wave-shooter opplegg. Det jeg savnet var utfordring og variasjon, jeg var udødelig og fienden virket inkompetent og ufarlig.
Får 2 stjerner da spillet fungerte til en viss grad.
 Ikke kjøp, bruk tid og penger på noe bedre
see title

review_title: Great game with a gamebreaking bug
one_reviews_text:
I completed the entire game on Hard Coop with my wife, and we had fun with it.   It holds up well even today with great voice acting and solid gameplay.  I also tried all 4 characters and unlocked all their abilities.  I only really enjoyed the Gun Cleric, but I like that all 4 had very different playstyles.  Although it only has 10 missions they have a good bit of diversity.  In any case, this WAS going to be a solid 4-star game I could easily recommend.  It has some minor issues, and no AI bots means that multiplayer is completely dead and you can't PvP, but still an easy 4-star recommend for the single player PvE or Coop PvE if you have a VR friend. 

HOWEVER, there is a bug on the Oculus Home version where progress is not always saved.  You might play for 2-3 hours, unlock tons of stuff, then quit and come back to find out 100% of that progess is gone.  What's funny/frustrating is that I still have all the Oculus Achievements for doing the unlocks, but all that progress in-game was erased.  At this point, I'm sure this bug will never be fixed since the game is so old, so buyer beware.  Only do 1 mission, then quit the game and load it back up to see if progress has saved.

review_title: Great game but multiplayer is dead.
one_reviews_text:
Game has a great story line, considering the short 10 missions its packed in to (first 2 rooms are the same, the other 8 are different, and the mechanics vary for each one). And minimal glitches, the only attack that feels clumsy is punching.  Bow works better than bows in most other VR games, same with swords.  Pistol and shotgun guy are fun too.

You unlock 6 total skills with each 4 characters as you play with each one.  Characters and skills are diverse enough to make multiple play throughs feel like different game play.

Multiplayer is dead.  No one else is ever on, can never join any other match, have tried at every time of day every day of the week.  Game would be way more fun otherwise.  Wish they would cut price to free or a couple dollars to boost the player base.

Smooth Locomotion is available, other than just teleporting.  Turning is always at a 45 degree snap though.

Seemed cool until I started the tutorial mission, then I couldn't equip the sword. Spent 10 minutes trying to grab it from over my shoulder at every angle possible like a dummy. Got it once over extending with my left hand on the left shoulder but then I dropped it and couldn't get it again so gg. 

Also sucked won't let you use direct movement until you complete the tutorial and I hate teleporting. This game needs some serious attention. I don't know what kind of insanely small hitbox it has for the sword hilt but its ridiculous. Would return if I could but I waited too long.

i absolutely love it just  there are lots off bugs on only the first four levels work properly the rest stop working robots dont come out no teleporting no walking have to reset it is just annoying and i have a good computer so it isnt tthat and i just want it to have a bug fix with the issues having a huge effect on gameplay and overall worth it but would be incredibly popular if it was fixed
love the bow  guy i slay robots with him  not into wave shooters but this one i definatly am !!

One of the absolute best games I have ever played.  Very engaging and the PvP is too good.  A lot of reviews say that its boring because you fight in the same room.  Guess what..... try saying more levels.  People that say its a defense game and its boring and too repetitive only played on the free weekend.  This game is just out of this world.
Tried this on the latest free weekend, and wow, all the bad reviews I read I was not expecting this... Great graphics, cool upgrades and loving the Coop and the campaign.... Very satisfying shooter!!

I love the story, gameplay, characters and etc, but I feel it was just a bit too laggy. When I reload I get lagspikes, and when multiple robots come out at once, the game can crash. Still, it is a good game.

I have bought so many top title steam an oculus store games. This game deserves 6 stars!. It's simply put, amazing. The sound effects, emersion, and garphics are awesome. But most of all, the guns feel real and the fighting is hectic without being just to stupidly hectic. I havent even played multplayer yet. Just tried the free weekend and thought I need to support this game. The japanese robot kamakazi voice when the bomber robot comes out gave me goose bumps at first.
Yeah its a wave shooter I guess, but a really cool story behind and also a cool lobby of other players to join with (in real time, can see each other). Seriously, its good. If you liked Irobot, this is 10x better in every way!. Join me if you see me playing, my gamer tag same as post: adapTiv8 - Im not exactly a young player either lol, but im not that old yet too! hahaha

i find people online here
https://discord.gg/dEPfPMM
This game is NOT worth the 40 dollars it costs, The game has NOBODY playing. And the story is about 4 hours long.

now, i was expecting a fun cool game and all but OMFG this game blew my mind,
i mean how did they make this its so clever and fun, of all the tons of fighting vr games this one is by far number one this should not be 40 dollars it should be like 100, it really is that great
Fantastic game should play it more, very fun loved how the game is fast and fun too. I think that you should try it because it fells great play it.

Well I played a few games now and this one is one of the good shooters... Nice special abilities of each class, good immersion and really fun to play. I play all games with locomotion if it's offered and in this game I don't get sick. Graphics and effects are good imo and it's somewhere between robo recall and dead & burried I think. Less multiplayer pvp focused but also not as much singleplayer as robo recall. If you like to throw bullets back you need to get the swordsman... he can reflect bullets with his sword.

Should be 10$ at max.
There are insane amount of glitches, and random crashes at times.

Barely anybody is playing too, so if you're only into co-op, do not buy this game.

And don't get me started on the story and level design (at least in levels 1-3)

review_title: I think on Steam there is a community.
one_reviews_text: Rift "Experiences" leaves me feeling alone and dead.
The game is good, but multiplayer is limited to only 2 players, and single player mode is boring. So much for "multiplayer".
This was one of the original games I played on the VR in a mall. I loved this game then and still love it now! great gun mechanics and pretty decent storyline as well
the storyline was ok, pretty good wave shooter. like the co-op mode! graphics are ok, overall, good game.

I like almost everything in VR, but I just can't get into this game. The guns feel toy-like. The robot enemies are simplistic and uninteresting. The story is dumb. Might be more fun with a friend or two? Maybe. By myself I'm bored to death. The game is polished enough, but I'm just not into it.

If I were looking to play an exciting wave shooter, I would choose Serious Sam over Raw Data every time.
This is one of the best wave shooters available right now. Only Robo Recall is better in my book but it lacks the multiplayer Raw Data have.

review_title: Great COOP shooter with added features!
one_reviews_text:
If you have just tested this game during old early access (like I did), just forget what you know and open your mind. My brother convinced me to re-try and I was pleasantly surprised. This full release has good content quantity, fighting mechanics are great and the immersion is beautiful. Great coop game and difficulty is good! 
It's like an awesome wave shooter, but with the ability to teleport and freely walk around which bring different combat dynamics. Also its really nice that all 4 playable characters have each unique abilities that need to be unlock. It forces you to try them. My favorite is definitely the lightsaber ninja.

Keep in mind that the Oculus Software won't let you run this game on Windows 7 (Although Steam will!) I made the mistake of buying it through Oculus instead of Steam, and now it won't even let me install it. Oh well.
review_feedback: Hey KainRift, Apologies for this Windows 7 problem. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com regarding this issue? Thank you for your patience!

review_title: perfect game for PVP competitive style.

Was pretty excited to play PVP in this game after checking some videos.  I have yet to see one person online.... Are people not playing online????

What can I say... it's a pretty decent (multiplayer) wave shooter (still I like Robo Recall better) and well worth it (in a bundle at least), but nothing really special in my view (I think that Survios' upcoming game Sprint Vector will be a whole lot more fun and innovative, but then again, Raw Data was their first VR game and I applaud them for it)
It is a very good game, the first one that I tried with the oculus and that made me buy them, what I do not understand is because it is not compatible with windows 7. In steam it is.

one_reviews_text:
Okay. So in one player. You get "Kill all robots and defend your base all in one room" combat. Not great as far as I've seen. But I havent gotten far. 2 Levels. Becaaaaaaaause.

Multiplayer is where it is at! This is the one and only competative full motion FPS so far for the rift. And it is excellent!

review_title: The best game I've never played
one_reviews_text:
Now the  bug that stops me from even starting the game is fixed, how about sorting out the system for grabbing the blade off my back. Did it the first time, since then it simply doesn't work. 

Plus, the teleport system is unhelpfully complicated - why not just emulate Robo Recall, the game *everyone* will have played already? on top of that, why do I have to keep facing in one direction? Why is my vision filled with arrows telling me to turn back whenever I turn around? Is it that hard to turn this stuff off based on the number of sensors detected?

I think it's refund time. You really shouldn't have released this with so many basic flaws unaddressed.
review_feedback: Hey Maddelson, sorry you've had a negative experience with the game. Just a heads up: You can disable "Show Playspace" under the Preferences tab of the in-game options - This will remove the assist arrows.

review_title: Rescinding my hate, great action game
one_reviews_text:
UPDATE: Don't buy it for the PVP, spawncampers have basically destroyed the community. It takes forever to find games with people at times, and it usually ends up being someone who kills you once and spends most of the rest of the match keeping you from getting more than 5 steps out of the spawn. 

Original: 

I seriously regret having jumped the gun on my previous review. 

I encountered an apparently very rare bug where the game doesn't save, but this isn't a part of the game. Survios support was VERY fast in responding to my email, and the issue was fixed within a matter of hours of me emailing them. 

This game is a hardcore action game, that feels very fluid. I started out using the teleshift function, but now I play with walking locomotion, smooth turning, and the comfort mode turned off. 

The game is very solid, from the wave defense campaign and cooperative, to the king of the hill style pvp which is reminiscent of Overwatch in that the characters are all distinct in how they can be played. 

Despite my strong words previously,
Raw Data is a game worth having. 

Rather, if you have VR, and don't have this game, you're wasting time and money.

Changed my original review to bump this up to four stars. I encountered a bug when I first downloaded and attempted to play, but the developers were quick to respond and issue a hotfix. Great job, guys! That being said, I really like this game. The graphics are polished and the voice acting is on point and amusing at times. The pistol feels like it has a bit of weight to it, and I like the mechanism for reloading. I try to always keep a fresh magazine in my off-hand for quicker reloads.  Headshots at a distance are hard to pull off, but hopefully I'll get better as I play more. Fighting off "undead" robots in the dark had my heart pounding... "Where are they???" I found the game immersive and fun, yet difficult at times. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a great 360-degree wave shooter.

Edited Review:
This new spin on robot defense has a lot of good ideas, but not if you're expecting a slicker version of Robo Recall.

There are a few things I found lacking in this game, but it would be unfair to compare only what other games have that Raw Data doesn't. So I'll start with what Raw Data has going for it.

Raw Data brings an assortment of character-customization options in the form of skills, powerful moves and four unique characters/classes, each with their own weapon specialties. The diversity between characters, as well as multiplayer co-op, should offer a lot of replayability.

This game tries new things in terms of gameplay, and mostly succeeds...if you don't mind waiting for the robots to come to you. Raw Data tries to be a story-driven arcade shooter/slasher, but misses its mark.

The story/gameplay: A plucky band of freedom fighters resists the machinations of an "evil corporation" by infiltrating various facilities, where they are inevitably attacked by robotic security.

Each mission takes place in a single area. Robots close in from all sides, and your options are to fight or die. Sometimes you defend a "Data Core," sometimes you just try to survive, placing turrets to help you. The bottom line is that you're always going to be on defense.

Defense can be fun, though. In co-op, the rush of enemies forces players to work together in order to survive. Your options for killing enemies are limited--shoot, slash, or special ability, and repeat.

At no point are you the aggressor, and melee is almost pointless. In terms of your sheer number of options for destroying robots, Robo Recall does it better. For melee and improvization on the fly, Super Hot does it better.
Raw Data, however, gets marks for inginuity and effort, breaking new ground in character customization in a new medium. Kudos.

***********************
Previous review (Fixed):
Issue with controller input solved by removing third sensor.
I enjoyed playing this game. However, it's been a month since it's initial release and I can't ever seem to find anyone to multiplay with :/
don't buy this.  It's a boring room defens map... just waves from stupid robots coming from every time the same points and engage you.  This game is that Boring ....

When I first picked this game up it was quite excellent. Certainly one of the best robot shooters on the market and probably the most fully realized experience I had at the time. Now, with the full release, it's even more impressive. Solid gunplay and decent challenge.

This is a wave defense shooter, so as long as you come into it expecting to be in a room defending against waves of robot enemies, you will not be disappointed!

The Game itself is nice. But its still soooo buggy. Can´t play 2 Games in a row without disconnect in multiplayer. And if you play the Ninja Class, i had sometimes the bug that i couldnt take my swords anymore. Very very annoying bugs. Please fix that.
review_feedback: Hey RedDragon38, Apologies for these issues you're experiencing. If you have the time, would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com so we can gather more information from you on these specific issues? No worries either way!

one_reviews_text:
This has to be one of the best games on VR yes it's a wave shooter but a very good one, the graphics are crisp and clean the movement is smooth and fast with or without free movement turned on, yes free movement does induce a little motion sickness when you start but after about 10 seconds you get used to it and it's awesome, every game should have this option, I was a little scepticle at first because of the price didn't want to pay £29.99 for a game that lasts 3 rounds but it's lot bigger than i thought. 
The accuracy of the aiming is a little off but nothing that can't be compensated for, all in all a very good, smooth, FUN game. Right Touch Issues Fixed Very Fast Great Job Dev's :-)

UPDATE:When I use the telekenetic power that the sword guy has, in stage 3 most of the time 1 enemy glitches out of the map forcing me to go back to lobby and restart the entire thing. Despite the bug i give 5 stars due to almost instant developer response :)

Over half way through and realized there's an option to free turn left and right instead of the annoying 90 degree swipe all games should have this option i don't know why dev's think everybody get's motion sickness it only lasts less than 10 seconds then you get used to it this game is fun but it's a wave shooter can't wait for more games that are not wave just normal shooter (cod vr please)

PROS:   
1. The reload of the weapons is cool.
    
CONS:   
UI is not polished. The graphics are overall kind of dissapointing. The robots are not even remotely cool. And a lot of bugs.        If you are looking for a cool robot game in VR I suggest Robo Recall. And I really wish Oculus had a refund policy...

At the start it's a cute but deeply unpolished wave shooter (like VR needs more of those) but as the game progresses it unleashes its secret obsession. Bullet sponges. Enemies that take hundreds upon hundreds of sword slashes arrows or bullets show up and reduce the game to what is quite possibly the worlds worst Wii waggleathon/ button masher. This game loves them with a fiery passion I can't even begin to imagine loving anything. If it loved them with the passion of a first love it might have a fraction of them, with the love of a firstborn child maybe even an appreciable fraction. But its love for them goes beyond mere obsession or psychopathy into something wholly incomparable in human history.

Everything else in pack 3 I'm looking forward to. I run windows 7. Wish I could return this I don't even want a game in lieu of it - I despise Oculus games that require Windows 8+. I had looked at Raw Data before and forgot this was why I never bought it. Already owned Killing Floor and The Climb.

-----------Edit: So, because I owned and played The Climb and Killing Floor prior to buying this bundle (which is the purpose of the bundle to "Complete Your Collection") I cannot refund this bundle.
review_feedback: Hey m1cr0star, Sorry for this Windows 7 problem. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com regarding this issue? Thank you for your patience!

review_title: Can't review this game in a vacuum
one_reviews_text: This game has potential in the concept--a VR co-op shoot-em-up but the execution is just not there. After having played games like Robo Recall, Raw Data comes out looking like amateurish in comparison. If VR was released in the 90s this is the kind of game I would have expected.
Really rough around the edges. A lot of the controls are not very intuitive. Fun game though. Got boring fast.

review_title: Doesn't work launching from Oculus Home
one_reviews_text:
Had to find game executable, launch it directly from folder with Admin privileges to get it to run.  I'll increase my rating once these issues are fixed.

***July 22nd Update

I ended up doing a Window s 10 refresh. Between my antivirus software (Bitdefender), Unreal engine pathing and some other issues, this and other titles were giving me issues upon trying to launch (that initially worked fine).  I am changing my review from 1, to 5 stars as this game continues to polish up well.
Bought as part of the essentials pack, reading about users on Steam that could play on Windows 7 and 8.1. Oculus Store won't even allow an install. Complete waste of time.
review_feedback: Hey bagel.smookler, Sorry you experienced this issue. We're in talks with Oculus to get this problem resolved as soon as possible. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com regarding this issue? Apologies again!

one_reviews_text: Been looking around for a good VR game for a while. There are so many games out there that just don't cut it. But Raw Data had me hooked from the get go. Melee + throwing weapons, a good solution for locomotion, two handed guns, progression, unlocks. Etc. etc. It actually feels like a real game, + PvP is coming. I don't know what more people want with the current state of the technology.
thanks for the dev's response, the issue was fixed, back at it

The cost is too high for something like this. The fact that it gets rated highly is ridiculous. I've played it once and it was just meh. I wish I bought it on steam so I could refund it. Graphically it looks pretty good...but it's just boring and didn't give me a reason to continue with it. There are better games for the same price or less. Avoid this. I might just start buying all my games from steam. This was a waste of money.

The tutorial is the worst I've ever played.  

Movement via teleportation is horrible.  Using a joystick to rotate in a VR game is idiotic and this game is the worst I've played about having to always face forward.  Turning a tiny bit to either side brings up arrows telling the player to rotate the view instead.  Using one joystick to move and one to rotate is idiotic as well.  Once I have room scale, I hope I wouldn't have this problem, but many people have only two sensors so they should know about this problem.  Robo Recall has teleportation down perfectly (no additional click needed) and it doesn't need to use two joysticks.

Weapons are decent, but requiring a movement joystick to do double duty as a weapon option selector is stunning.  Don't they test funtionality?  Don't they play other games to see how things are done better?

No way is this game worth the money I played.  Until they get the movement right, I wouldn't even recommend this as a free game.  If they get the movement right, I still wouldn't recommend this game at the premium it's price.

I hate to be so negative, but without a trial, players need to know about this game before they pay a premium price.
Wow what a game really well polished, great graphics and sound, cannot wait till more content is released, very similar to robo recall so if you like that you will probably like this...

As a first VR shooter contact, i was really impressed ! but with time, i find this game repetitive and a little boring...
But need to try it.

The shooting gameplay is quite good. I'm coming into it having played the like of Robo Recall though, which just seems to do this a lot better. The teleporting effect is a bit headachey. It just doesn't need the light flicker effect.

I was aware it was a wave shooter. I just downloaded everything as soon as I got my Rift. It quickly gets repetative and boring.

I like the holster and reload mechanic, but it gets a bit tired when game doesn't pick up your reload action.

This games been out a fair while now, but I found constant problems with the menu system. Kept having to reload the game to get the menus back.

Overall a decent shooter, but I wouldn't want to pay too much for it. Get Robo Recall instead.
review_feedback: Hey Sitruz, regarding the bug with the menus not displaying for you: This is a known issue that should be fixed in a future update. Apologies for the inconvenience. In the meantime, the workaround is to progress through the whole matchmaking tutorial - after doing so, the menus should not disappear on you. Hope this helps!

one_reviews_text: I read a few of those negative reviews and held off buying these when it was on sale. A few days ago i decided to bite the bullet and just see what everyone on reddit was raving about. And oh my god do i regret not buying this earlier. The control scheme easily surpasses the one from Robo Recall. But if you so desire, you can just toggle locomotion off and play like you would RR. It is still better, since there always is a forward indicator (kind off), that RR is missing. Also it has multiplayer, which RR has not. My recommendation is: Get both, both are great games, you wont regret it.
UPDATED, Don't jump to conclusions, this game has solid gunplay, sword could be better but the class system is amazing. Each character is different. Find a friend to play with to make it better. 3/5

Compared to a lot of titles out there, this is certainly more in the AAA neighborhood, but still leaves a bit to be desired. Graphically it's quite pretty, when it isn't bugging, chopping, or tearing (which happens with some frequency). The weapons are a lot of fun to use and the reload mechanic is cute, when the tracking actually works and lets you draw your gun, or reload it without dropping it, or ready your special arrow, or draw your sword, and so on. Granted, "When it works" is most of the time, but not all the time, and issues pop up frequently enough that it feels less like a setup fluke, and more like an actual problem. More than any other title I've tried, this one NEEDS room scale. 

Movement is awkward and unintuitive. One stick controls forward/back/lateral movement, and the other the actual direction of view. The view direction stick also serves to call up your weapon context menu, however, so you often find yourself rotating your field of view when you intended to activate a special ability, or vice versa (if you're extra skilled, you can shift your field of view and THEN trigger a special at nothing). Walking style locomotion is available too, but (for me at least) the motion sickness becomes too much too fast (and PVP is all walking style), and even with the walking style, your field of view is still controlled with the stick. 

PVP and co-op is a lot of fun...when the netcode is stable and not laggy as heck.

While definately a longer title, what starts off as unique and refreshing gameplay is quickly replaced by uninspired waves of dramatically increasingly difficult enemies with a cookie cutter cyberpunk story going on around you. 

Despite its flaws, it's still one of the best wave shooters the rift has to offer and is more than worth grabbing on sale or in a bundle. A Triple A title that winds up about a b+

Feels very theatrical and thrilling like you are on one of the high tech rides at amusement parks. Goal is not much different from Robo Recall - defeat wave after wave of enemies, but with many more creative ways to do it. But here are the cons. If you don't have 3 sensors it will kind of ruin the experience. You would not be able to turn around at all as the game expects you to face forward all the time (with joystick rotation). I disagree that Robo recall has a better teleportation mechanic, because its teleportation is slow and one-click is much faster for evading enemies. Don't like teleporting? you can walk, provided you can overcome the motion sickness. Lastly I think the menus could be more intuitive because it feels bulky like one of those Japanese games. Maybe make the player walk to more kiosks instead of selecting a menu.

I got this game as part of the Adventure Pack from the Summer Deal's and I was not expecting much, but wow going online and playing PVP is great! If you want to experience an FPS type PVP game,  pick this one up! It also barely took 20 seconds to find a game and people kept joining.
It has the fastest pace PvP ive played in VR.  Do you think it feels good to get a kill in Overwatch with Hanzo? Well getting a kill with a bow and arrow in this game is 10 times better.

Actually quite a well implemented game, for room scale its actually not that bad once you enable those settings to remove the annoying popups that you get if you face away from your main sensors.

My advice, if you have 3 or more sensors fore room scale, turn off the stupid popups that get in the way.
Enable smooth turning, if you decide to use that.

Your find there are a lot of settings that arnt really marked well for what they do or the hidden.

Also i found that i get no motion sickness with locomotion movement, unlike Arizona Sunshine... just seems more natural.

Things they could of done better, intro/tutorial as it doesn't seem to be very intuitive in introducting you to the controls and concepts applied in this game.
Also Robots seem a little plain, considering what roborecall has provided in terms of AI
Buggy, unsteady performance, terrible locomotion system, and the shooting mechanics aren't as good as Robo Recall.

I don't like the control scheme. Robo recll does teleporting so much beter. Also the tutorial bugged on me and I can't start it so I don't know how to melee. I do like the premise, atmosphere, and design -if the control issues and bugs are fixed, I'd give this a solid 4.
Feels very janky, gets boring after the first mission as most of them are the same. Stand and await for waves of enemies.

review_title: Not enough content for the asking price!
one_reviews_text:
I don't care if this game is in early access. That is no excuse for the shallow amount of content on display here. Bought this game on impulse becuase my friends and I were looking for something to play and am a bit dissapointed. Not becuase the game is bad, but becuase of the price tag. This game shouldn't be more than $20 if you ask me. It's really hard to justify paying for only a dozen levels of what is simply a horde mode. 3 playable classes that are all pretty mediocre, with bland abilites. 

That's really all this game is right now. An average game with average content. If you're looking for a shooter, play Superhot VR or Robo Recall. They are much meatier and costs half the price.

I found this game very fun ,but I was expericening crashes quite frequently. Did a little research and found that if you are runnig a nividia gpu check your driver update. If you are running version 382.33 or 382.53 then you need to go to a rollback version of your driver. 

hope this helps

I just played it for an hour, fairly say it was a satisfying experience and the game play is so intense. Shooting feels good but not as comfotable as Roborecall. Generally, it's a good game especially for buying it on sale.

Awesome Shooter, I love 3/4 Heros... Most work Amazing, except the Shotgun, its buggy. Also I reccomend 3rd Sensor because you will start out facing your screens but end up upside down facing the ceiling fan. lol

I enjoy it alot, played with several people and had a great time blasting and slashing enemies. I would rate it five stars, but that would require the melee to be tweaked a little better. I would love to slam and proactively unload on enemies, but I feel slightly limited.
I chose the robot ninja character, and then I became a jedi knight. That was one of the most intense and amazing experiences of my life.

... but it crashes after 10 minutes (cannot even finish the first mission). I have the NVIDIA Driver version 382.53 installed. I will wait for the next patch before playing this again... I give you 4 stars (in advance) though. Because I think that the game is worth it and you seem to try fixing this issue. I am really looking forward to playing the game properly at some point.


/EDIT Ah, didn't know that 382.53 is broken as well. Seems to be working fine with 382.05. Thanks for the help! Really like this game.
review_feedback:
Hey again, Glad to hear rolling back to driver 382.05 helped this issue :)
Just wanted to let you know that Hotfix 0.6.5 should allow you to play with the latest Nvidia drivers without crashes. Thank you again for your patience!

one_reviews_text: People complain about it not being worth the price. You get alot more out of this than many similarily priced games. Good fun.

It's a nice game, I like the way you load your handgun by grabbing your ammo and slide it into your gun. Also movement works good and fast. But the game crashed after 20 minutes of playtime. *Update: Thanks for quick response! I will check this game out this week and let you know if it works better now.
review_feedback: No problem! If the crashing persists, please contact us at support@survios.com to further troubleshoot your issue. Thank you again for your patience!

one_reviews_text: Very bad shotgun animations and placement, cant actually aim with it, sword is awful and teleporting with the sword is just overpowered

review_title: One of my  favorites so far in VR
one_reviews_text: This Game is a great FPS, great Multiplayer, and very polished for still being in early release. Oh and a good amount of content not just for being in early release, even compared to fully finished titles. Would of liked a little bit more of a break on $$ but still worth it..

review_title: Constant crashes ruin what would be good
one_reviews_text:
I really enjoy this game, it has so much good stuff to offer but the constant crashes and bugs make it almost unplayable. I really like the weapon systems and the Katana is just a joy but I can't get the game to run for longer than 10 mins consistently. Weapons drop through the floor, the shotgun got stuck on my back and the game crashes to desktop often and usually within the first 10 mins of play, I've had this problem on 2 iterations of NVidia drivers both the latest and the previous one. For £23 it's just not worth it, which is such a shame as it should be a "go to" VR experience.

UPDATE - Even rolled back to the NVidia driver that was launched alongside this game specifically and still get multiple crashes.
review_feedback: Hey neo1875, sorry for the constant crashes you've been experiencing with the game. There is a known issue with the 382.33 Nvidia Driver that has caused the game to crash, but it sounds like you already tried rolling back to an older driver. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com to further troubleshoot this issue? Thank you for your patience! EDIT: We pushed out Hotfix 0.6.5 last night that should have fixed this Nvidia crashing issue. Let us know if you still endure these crashes.

review_title: Windows 10 ONLY! Just got ripped off?
one_reviews_text: Just bought the game, then read the fine print that it is Windows 10 ONLY. I have not even downloaded the game. Would like a refund please.
review_feedback: Hey VREventHorizon, apologies for this problem! Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com regarding this issue? Thank you for your patience!

one_reviews_text: Comfortable to use. Tutorial could have been better but the rest of the game is A+ Already great mods out to make it even better.

review_title: Cool idea but not worth the money
one_reviews_text: If you compare this to Robo Recall u will be disapointed, trust me. Shooting doesnt feel as real as in robo recall, not even close to. Feels like lagging or something. Totally overhyped game. If steam users think this is ground braking they really should rather buy an Oculus and try Robo Recall and more games because this is worth 15-20€ at maximum.

review_title: Close to good, but the controls fail it
one_reviews_text: The game itself isn't bad, the controls are a bit terrible though, specifically the rotation. Clicking a button to rotate 90 degrees over and over, is a very poor design choice, Robo Recall did it right.

Well I've bought the game without noticing it was requiring Windows10 but heard it worked on Win7. I've emailed support and they promptly given me a steam key. I can now play this great games on Windows 7 through Oculus library!
Really good game too!

If you compare to Robot Recall, the controls (for movements, or handling weapons) are rather unpleasant. It feels like Google Earth after a forced launch on Oculus: you have to press the stick to move. Relevant on Vive, very unpleasant on an Oculus Touch. I jumped on the game, having thought the controls had been adapted for the touch, but it's not fully the case yet.

Anyway, the game is interesting otherwise, a lot of potential, and its an alpha, so definitively worth looking, waiting for the controls improvements :)

A lot of bugs like not natural weapon positions, weapon stucks, enemies go through objects. It's early access so i hope to change my opinion, but on this stage i dont recommend it. I've played once and i'm not willing to play it again until bugs are fixed.

review_title: Best FPS game of the year? HARDLY.
one_reviews_text:
While Raw Data definitely is a "Decent" FPS shooter, it is it's own genre of shooter. If compared to something like bullet train, or super hot, or robo recall, it doesn't compare in the least. Everyone is so hyped up over this game, As any game with teleportation. It sucks hard. If all fps games would simply implement choice of locomotion for their users there would be alot better ratings. In terms of shooter types, this one is definitely unique. I like that it's multiplayer and that multiplayer works fairly well. Unlike Arizona Sunshine which can never seem to connect to anyone despite there being players online. The special moves are okay, and the puzzles/survival rounds this game provide are very challenging and very fun when played with "Likeminded" people. all in all this is a good game.

However again the reason i deduct two stars is for locomotion and the sword controls feel ultra fake. The ninja like character's sword movements are not very convincing. and even though you can hack limbs off, the teleport mechanic always keeps you at a bit more than arms length which either makes you have to over extend your arms to hit, thus killing the immersion. Or Putting you too close to the bots to where you have to curl your arms in which then feels like you are throwing a cross and hook rather than swinging your sword.

The character known as "Boss" the shotgun is ultra wonky with pumping the shotgun and almost always results in never cocking the shotgun to be able to shoot. Especially in the laser dodging portion where movement and aim are key.

So two stars taken for the teleport mechanic and lack of fluid movement system. IMO Robo recall remains the best FPS on the market.

review_title: Another Great Title Made Its Way To Rift
one_reviews_text: Great experience and workout! less polished then robo recall but is still a gem as far as vr games are concerned. Will Update my review once it is out of early acces.
... if you're going to obsolete relatively modern OSes in a bundle, tell your consumers first.
review_feedback: Hey PaleJackal, Apologies for this problem. We're still in talks with Oculus to get this specific issue resolved asap. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com regarding this issue?

one_reviews_text: I've played plenty of VR games with players and friends. This is the only game people ask me again, "Can I play that again?". It's in the works, yes, but this is a game that will rise above other shooters, and have its own true title. Good job devs.

This game had the misfortune of being released for the Rift AFTER Robo Recall. If it had been released months earlier, like on the Vive, it would have been much more impressive. That said, I actually like its slightly retro-futuristic graphics. It just doesn't "wow" to the same degree it might have at one time. Don't get me wrong, it's still a good game, and I like the graphics and the first-person perspective, but it's not the first game to fight robots or to show a panoramic cityscape (ala Technolust) as it once was. Aside from that, there are other niggles, such as the teleporting control scheme and other controls. Teleporting isn't even as well implemented as on Robo Recall; I don't like how you use one control (a thumbstick) to teleport and another control (a button) to change direction. I wish game developers could get together and agree on some standard control scheme for all games, so you don't have to relearn everything or to mentally switch gears every time you launch a different game.
This game is definitely fun.  It has a few bugs here and there but the devs are quick to respond to issues and they release a fairly steady stream of updates.  I've been impressed so far.
like the concept, but poor play and control on my system.  Robo Recall is amazing compared to this.  Weapons are constantly stuck in this game.  So Frustrating, haven't even gotten to blade play.

There are bugs that need to be corrected (loss of second pistol in the game, sometimes start device falls through floor. etc), but overall a great concept/wave shooter. Creating a multiplayer campaign (i.e. with RPG elements) would be out of this world amazing!! Having fun though!!

This is a great start of a VR game, Love the Plasma Sword. The game itself is a tad bit glitchy and the start of it make sure you have configured your height correctly otherwise the motion concept is way off and were hard to see.  Can't wait to see how this one will play out in the future.
Amazing game! In my opinion just as good and fun as Robo Recall.  The teleportation and snap turning is GENIUS and needs to be implemented in more games going forward.  Again, VERY GOOD AND FUN GAME!

review_title: Can't get past the hand scanner. ERROR.
one_reviews_text: And apparently Oculus doesn't do refunds? This was not a good use of £30.
review_feedback:
Hey lampholder,

Sorry you ran into this issue.
I responded to the bug report you submitted.

Talk to you soon!
UPDATE: Just wanted to let you know that our 0.7 Update should have fixed this issue. Now if you touch the Hand Scanner once, the percentage should fully go to 100% - You won't have to hold your hand for the whole duration.
Apologies again for the inconvenience this has caused you!

one_reviews_text: By far the worst VR game I've played. It's a buggy piece of garbage with a broken level system and terrible wave shooter mechanics.
review_feedback:
Hey trate25,

Apologies for the negative experience you had with the game. 

If you have the time, would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com and sharing the bugs you've endured with Raw Data?
We'd really appreciate this information and would be more than happy to help troubleshoot any issues you've come across.

one_reviews_text:
Having played SuperHot, Bullet Train, RoboRecall and a few others; Raw Data had some big shoes to fill. But its' certainly filled those shoes while also maintaining its own distinct personality. 
The gameplay (as of this review is still in Alpha) is frantic but well controlled; completed phases leave you feeling relieved. Multiplayer is where I feel this game really shines; you haven't lived until you've fist bumped someone who clearly doesn't speak your native language while dancing on a pile of robot corpses. 
There are some drawbacks: for instance odds and ends on the bug side of things. However, it must be remembered that this is in fact an alpha and some leeway should be given in this respect. 
In conclusion I recommend this if you're looking for a shooter you can play with random strangers online and have a blast doing it. It's already solid and will only improve with beta and the full release.
Love it, to relaxe and enjoy in Casual mode.  Stress is not too high, lot of action and FUN. Ideal to play with freinds.

I also think the "Teleport" to move is no good..  Same problem as Robo Recall.
However in the single player game you dont really move so thats not so bad.
When I was in the main room with the other people I did not feel the movement worked at all.   Has alot of potential.  Look foward to the next update.  I would add regular movement and make it players option.
Fun game overall and is very entertaining however small bug fixes and there needs to be multiplayer pvp and it would be a 5/5
Single player is great and the format makes it very easy to interact with other player in and out of co-op matches.
